title: Left-leaning leader wins Sri Lanka presidential vote
content: Anura Kumara Dissanayake beat his rivals after a historic second round of vote counting.
summary: Anura Kumara Dissanayake beat his rivals after a historic second round of vote counting.

title: Four dead and 18 hurt in Alabama mass shooting
content: Police say multiple gunmen fired on a group of people outside on a street in the city of Birmingham.
summary: Police say multiple gunmen fired on a group of people outside on a street in the city of Birmingham.

title: At least 51 dead in Iran coal mine explosion
content: At least 51 people are reported to have been killed after a gas leak sparked a blast in eastern Iran.
summary: At least 51 people are reported to have been killed after a gas leak sparked a blast in eastern Iran.

title: German far right eyes win in Scholz's state
content: The German chancellor's hopes of a second term could be in doubt as polls open in Brandenburg.

title: Kenya to send 600 more police officers to Haiti
content: This will bring the Kenyan contingent helping Haitian police fight gangs up to 1,000.

title: Dissident in prisoner swap vows to return to Russia

title: Trump rejects second TV debate as 'too late'

title: Macron unveils new right-wing French government
content: The new cabinet pulls in allies from the centre and right, despite left-wing parties winning France's election.

title: Israel orders 45-day closure of Al Jazeera West Bank office

title: Israel strike kills 22 in Gaza school, says Hamas-run health ministry
content: Israel says it hit a Hamas command centre, while Palestinian officials said most killed were women and children.

title: One dead and several missing after 'unprecedented' rains in Japan

title: Watch: Hundreds of paratroopers leap to mark daring WW2 offensive
content: Veterans watched the jump, at Ginkel Heath near the Dutch town of Ede, to commemorate Operation Market Garden.
